part.Name: Description
part.Short: A small bottle composed of thin {{plastifer|plastifer}}, complete with removabale lid. Not terribly sturdy, but very portable.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A small bottle composed of transparent {{plastifer|plastifer}}, complete with screw-top removable lid. Not terribly sturdy, but very portable in its ability to carry up to 28 drams.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: Although slight variations in design, large and lightweight {{plastifer|plastifer}} containers that are designed for storing liquids up to 128 drams. {{Plastifer|Plastifer}} {{w|jugs}} can hold most liquids, except the extremely hot.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A large, {{Y|steel}} container used to hold fluids in bulk, up to 256 drams. Even when empty, it smells faintly of oil.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A large metallic cylinder designed to hold bulk amounts of fluid. While covered in scratches and dents, there seems to not be any leaks. While useful, it would probably be a mistake to carry with you.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A small glass tube that is open at both ends. In the center lays a glimmering crystal suspended. It rotates slowly, and upon closer inspection the crystal seems to contain the visage of countless stars. The container defys gravity, ostensibly returning to the heavens?

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A black aegis bearing the Holy Rhombus of the Putus Templar.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A black aegis bearing the Holy Rhombus of the Putus Templar.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: This black slab of metal has been burnished clean of any symbol that may once have emblazoned its matte surface.

part.Name: Description
part.Short: A black aegis bearing the Holy Rhombus of the Putus Templar.
